properties.displayName: UniFi Site Manager - Multiple Devices Offline
properties.description: Detects when multiple UniFi devices go offline simultaneously. This typically indicates a network-wide issue such as power outage, upstream connectivity failure, or infrastructure problem requiring immediate investigation.
properties.query:
// UniFi Multiple Devices Offline Detection
// Author: Fetch Labs (https://sentinel.blog)
let OfflineThreshold = 3;
UniFiSiteManager_Devices_CL
| where TimeGenerated > ago(30m)
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by id
| where status == "offline"
| summarize 
    OfflineDeviceCount = count(),
    OfflineDevices = make_list(coalesce(name, id)),
    OfflineModels = make_list(model),
    OfflineIPs = make_list(ip),
    ProductLines = make_set(productLine)
| where OfflineDeviceCount >= OfflineThreshold
| extend 
    TimeGenerated = now(),
    OfflineDeviceList = strcat_array(OfflineDevices, ", "),
    AffectedProductLines = strcat_array(ProductLines, ", ")
| project
    TimeGenerated,
    OfflineDeviceCount,
    OfflineDeviceList,
    AffectedProductLines

alertDetailsOverride.alertDisplayNameFormat: UniFi Mass Offline Event: {{OfflineDeviceCount}} Devices Down
alertDetailsOverride.alertDescriptionFormat: {{OfflineDeviceCount}} UniFi devices have gone offline simultaneously. Affected product lines: {{AffectedProductLines}}. This may indicate a network-wide issue requiring immediate attention.
